pros: Collabera is a second home to me. It's been a decade I have spend with Collabera and have found lot of life time memories. Starting from my better  half to what I have been able to achieve in my professional journey is all because of Collabera. I have got utmost care, respect and knowledge required to be a successful individual within staffing industry. It's my bread and butter and I am thankful for it.
cons:
There have been instances where I felt company could have done better on some of below things -
1. Better evaluation of training needs for individuals. There have been many instances where company has been repetitively giving the same subjective training year over year which I feel is not required and should pick and choose some better subjects for individual and self development.
2. There is lot of overlap in hierarchy and unwanted titles within the departments which doesn't give clear picture for individual growth.
3. At times, there have been instances where people are wrongly promoted just to elevate other favorite person.  
4. Biased approach at times have been visible in different offices/dept with offshore and onshore.
story: Employee centric culture is the best what I have seen all these years where starting from CEO to execute level management person is approachable to give solutions to your problem.

pros: Exposure to the coorperate industry. Provides a good distingush between onshore and offshore models.
cons: Reduced work-life balance. Processes need to be more streamlined, and there shouldn't be a scope for modification on the basis of teams and departments. Excessive manual work at the ground-level, though we are transforming all the systems with the help of advanced technologies.
story:
Positive:

Blaze: There is a collective celebration of successes on a large platform which encourages the core value of Collabera, 'work hard, play hard'. 
Team trips: A company sponsering a trip every year for each team is a gesture to appreciate. 

Negative:

The approach is delivery-oriented, wherein both sales and delivery should have an equal footing and respect. 
The regional sales teams are still getting appreciated and acknowleged for their efforts; however, the offshore sales team does not receive the similar recognition. 
Another point is the incentive structure which does not seem as lucrative for the employees.

pros: Freshly out of the college and Joining Collabera, I was a little scared since this was the 1st time I was joining a corporate world. Collabera definitely provides a great basic framework for someone to start and grow in an upwards manner. The environment is very supportive and the leadership has great patience to nurture the talent. The kind of work environment that is created does motivate everyone to grow exponentially and excel in there work.
cons:
The good thing is we have very fewer downsides from a ground-level employee perspective. 
1. Work hours are stretched a lot.
2. The average Base Salary for a 4-5 year experienced recruiter is way less than what competitions are offering.
 3. Fewer certifications/training programs are available
4. Better operation infrastructure like Laptops/Big Screen ( Alike Us offices) instead of desktop.
These are a few downsides that definitely affect the motivation of employees in direct/in-direct ways.

pros: Me being a recruiter, I always want a best client/responsive client to work on, where i really can see some ROI, in terms of time and effort I put. cons:
favoritism/Biasness
Every other manager/every other team has a separate way of evaluating performance and rewarding recruiters, which definitely discourages a performer more vs. an average/non-performing recruiter
Managers act as devil's advocate to create conflict within team and just strict in following process, without realizing how much it's impacting team's cohesiveness.   
Monopoly of managers
Throwing a decision to recruiter and ask them to follow without even evaluating how beneficial is that outcome will be

We are only responsive beyond imagination towards client
, not to employees.

Insanely comparative in each manner--we try our best to stay on top of competition--Digital training must be a great example to it.

We show "Discipline in execution" only to client, to get the work done, management put lots of pressure, create internal stress   ......

pros:
Continuous opportunity to learn and grow are the best reasons to work at Collabera. These factors have helped me and various individuals to achieve various small & big life goals in a timely manner which is what anyone would expect from their employer.

Above all the core values of Collabera, add a different level of spark in individual lives.
cons: Many a times, at a corporate level, onshore and offshore engagement misses out. I personally feel that an onshore and offshore competition would greatly boost morale of various individuals across the board.
story:
Though the journey has been long, I would add about the time when I started with the organization. There was a day when the whole team received offers for their candidates. We were on day-end huddle and client shared 3 offers that day. During that call we received confirmation from client for 7 more candidates belonging to each recruiter in the team and each sales individual had atleast 1 offer.
We celebrated this win after hours as a team.

This clearly displays the competitiveness & passion while each sales was pushing hard to get those offers, the hard working team which made sure that they play hard post their hard work.

pros:
direct relationships with the clients and hiring managers, our submissions don't go waste. we definitely get the feedback with Yes/ No/ May be.
Very good incentive structure.
No much distance between the employees of different levels. Senior level managers are easily approachable.
Complete security for women employees in the office.
cons:
Some of our managers leak out the issues that we discuss with them in cabins instead of keeping them confidential and help us in resolving it. 

Not everyone gets an opportunity to be a part of particular task, rather same people gets to participate/ enjoy the benefits. 

Penalty/ deduction of incentives if we don't have a start in a month is wrong.

Deduction of part of our incentives towards the bank amount every month is very painful because incase things don't work and we leave the company in between then we lose the money [our own money] deducted towards bank amount.

Friendliness between managers and favorite employees on floor leads to those particular employees getting considered for most of the opportunities/ perks, resulting in the other employees getting effected.
story: I would always appreciate one of the 5 principles that Collabera follows - Work Hard, Play Hard. The way festivals are celebrated in office even after having so much work pressure is really great.

story: It was my first Diwali at Collabera and was just the time when my Manager, Ingrid Nelson(no longer with Collabera) had flown down from US. I had come all decked up but was ready to work and was sitting besides her making keystrings and searching profiles to call candidates. She said, “Today is your day. You should go out there and celebrate. I know you are in the office but it is okay to not work for a while”. That struck me hard and it really meant a lot to me. She was never one to let us go without working but she also knew when we wouldn’t have to. Demonstrating one of our Collabera cultural values “Work hard, play hard” quite literally.

pros: Main reasons to work at Collabera: Revolutionary journey & progress of the company in past decade, great clients to work with, strong internal culture & diversified teams, investment in development of employees & other areas.
cons: Heavy dependency on a few clients (need faster expansion model to win new/additional clients), no matching on 401K plans, too pricey family health insurance plan,
story:
1. Passion to excel has always been my work style, which resonate well with Collabera's cultural values.
In the beginning of my journey (as a recruiter), I was given a challenge of submitting 25 resumes/week. Not only I took that challenge but met/exceeded that target for 7 consecutive weeks, and received performer of the week accolade for all 7 weeks!
2. Excellence in execution: I was tasked to manage a large transition project with a very aggressive deadline; and with the help of my winner team we successfully completed transition of about 300 resources to Collabera within 4 months, with excellent client satisfaction & appreciation.
3. Work hard Play hard: Everyone needs an opportunity to show their personal side! I have won Collabera's Pumpkin Carving/Painting Competition twice in last two years in our regional office.

pros:
Collabera believes in people, we care and respect our employees and their needs.
We believe in working really hard, however, we've multiple extra-curricular opportunities
Very High Growth Opportunities.
Competitive Environment Makes It Interesting!
We don't give up just like that, we believe in creating a success story
It's easy to communicate with the leadership group
Appreciation in regards to the performance and effort an individual is putting is commendable
We believe in excellence
cons:
It seems a bit unfair with GBS and Corporate functions when their success stories are not shared with entire Collabera
On a smaller scale, there's favoritism, which at times results into disengagement
Some of mid-level delivery management are still working with the old mindset, wherein they're not ready to evolve with the new and advanced culture
story:
A race to reach the Blaze stage or to enter into PC or 10K club clearly shows how insanely competitive we're in a healthy manner
Day-in-day-out, we work with the recruiters whose performance is not upto the mark, we don't give up unless we've tried each and every possible way to enhance the same, shows we care about our employees
Various small scale competitions, Fun-Fridays, CPL, CVPL signifies our Work-Hard, Play-Hard Culture
And there're many more great examples!

One incident on an area of improvement side:
Recently, I won quarterly award and a friend of mine congratulated me with an Instagram story, due to which a Sales Manager of Collabera congratulated me for the same in-front of the Delivery team. 
Followed by the congratulations from various DM/ ADM/ LR, they mentioned, why isn't this shared with Delivery? We're never told who is winning which award! 
Maybe a little transparency between various functions in terms of achievements will really help!

pros: I feel like my voice gets heard and that my opinion is valued. story: Responsiveness - one of our core values. This is an attribute I feel I have and it's part of my whole experience here with Collabera. I made several connections with my clients in one state and most of the time I didn't get a successful hire. However, my relationship was strong because of my responsiveness and willingness to help with whatever my client needed. When I moved to a different state, one of my past relationships gave me a referral. This new referral turned into a new client and I received my first five hires since I started working with my new team 5 months ago. I truly believe that kindness, willingness to help, and being responsive is what matters to our client. And in turn, the commission helps too.

pros: Coming from a different work background, I would describe my journey as a learning one and in the end a fruitful. I admire how my hard work has been appreciated at every stage and my leaders who have supported me to achieve it. Working with Collabera, I feel like a true professional which helps me behave mannerly in other aspects of life as well
cons: Even though there is appreciation given at every stage, I feel based on an individuals tenure, their opinions/suggestions should be considered for the betterment of the organization. Also one's past remuneration and title should not be considered while offering a job after analyzing the individual thoroughly. I have seen people coming back to with such suggestions and is my personal experience as well. Another thing that can be inculcated is TRUST. I feel that my piers do not trust me on my decisions made even though they turn out to be fruitful.
story:
I recently received the below email from one of my client VMO team member and I feel is the right story to share:
"I am very happy that Collabera made it through the rationalization and will be continuing their relationship with Conduent. 
 
As you know I very much enjoy working with you because of your friendly, prompt, accurate followup and knowledge/adherence to our processes...but really what makes Collabera stand out is their high fill rate, quick response times and building relationships with managers. I feel that Collabera would not be as successful in the program as they are without you - so keep up the great work!"

This email clearly highlights the Collabera values which I have given a face to.
Insanely Competitive: Collabera was always part of every challenge given by this client.

Responsive Beyond Imagination: This is something that Collabera has taught me from day 1 and I have been appreciated for it time and again by the clients. Once again in the statement above from the VMO, "quick response times".

Passionate to service clients and employees: Always the number 1 priority for me taught again by Collabera ("building relationships with managers")

Work Hard Play Hard: We worked hard for this account and got rewarded by making it to the final 8 list in the recent rationalization for the same client ("I am very happy that Collabera made it through the rationalization and will be continuing their relationship with Conduent")

Disciplined in Execution: Always treated the client with respect and never took anything for granted. This is the primary reason there has been no escalation for the last 3 years for this client.

I will go back to the days I was managing Toronto as a business owner and not as a DM, because I created all the tools and online portal for Collabera working hand in hand with AppDev team and Operations, it was one thing that has helped my team to do better at work and also they were able to do multi-tasking like other US recruiters.

pros:
1. Associated with Collabera, I am into serving the humans with a way to earn their bread. It gives me happiness when I am able to provide a job to a deserving person which in turn will act as the source of bread-butter earning. 

2. It gives a proud feeling to work with Collabera, a company which is the market leader and a trend-setter in the staffing industry. 

3. One always wants that the company he/she is working, should value its employees. Collabera stands to this statement. I as a Collabera employee has witnessed this during the COVID pandemic. The company announced that no lay-off would be done, no salary deductions would be made. This gives a happy feeling and satisfaction that I am associated with a firm which not only says but proves by actions when it comes to valuing employees. 

4. The open and always charged work culture, with nearly same age-groups working with you, the energy that one can feel in the company campus is something which you won't find in other companies. I have my many friends working in spreaded IT companies and while discussing with them, I feel that they all are lacking the atmosphere which Collabera has in its offices.
cons:
1. Working with Collabera somewhat hampers the social life. I feel that there is no social life after the working hours, it might be due to the night working shift because of which the majority of the daytime is spent in sleeping. 
The same thing happens on weekend too.

2. I personally feel that until now, people in India relate a night job to "Call Center/BPO" only, and this makes a task of explaining what our job is about, a bit tough. 

3. I won't say it as a downside but when works with Collabera, the open ground and the opportunities that he/she gets while working in Collabera vanishes when you switch to any other competitor company. In any other company you feel tied to some rope. This shows the working environment that Collabera provides.
story:
It was during July end of 2019 when heavy rains lashed Vadodara. Complete city was flooded within hours. Me and my manager too were among many who were stranded in the city, far from home, away from office. Some who managed to reach the office were working to keep the business going. 

Me and my manager were stuck in the flooded water till midnight, after which we somehow managed to our home. 
For the next 3 days, due to continuous rains, we were locked in our homes. Employees were not able to reach our office. During that time, many managers and senior leadership of Collabera was on the ground working like hell to carry employees to the office. They were running their cars continuously picking up employees from their locations and bringing them to the office. 

This showed the company's culture of valuing its employees. The company would have easily deducted the salary of those employees who failed to make it to the office in those floods. But Collabera lived to make the culture a truth and not just a saying. 
********************************

The second experience is from the lockdown that was imposed from Mar - May during the COVID situation. Majority of the Collabera employees are not local to Vadodara and announcement of a sudden lockdown created panic among the people. Everything was closed, whether it be rations, medical, logistics! 
Although the Indian corporate world was gradually shifting to the WFH culture at that time but as Collabera never did a WFH ever so we weren't sure about it. 

But sensing the situation, company shifted to WFH within 2 days. The complete Vadodara management was on toes to implement WFH without any problem. 

Not stopping at this, Collabera also came as a savior for those who were not local to Vadodara and were facing severe food related problems as all the shops, public canteens, supermarkets, ration supply was closed. 
During that time, Collabera arranged for a regular meal service for the interested employees. The company also provided facility for any needed ration supplies. 

Also, the company announced that the job security would be taken care of. This announcement sparked a feeling of trust and safety among the employees during those very dark unprecedented times.

pros: Some best reasons are - the exposure to different kind of jobs and industries, the work culture environment, strong network, learning updated technology, no limited work – there is always a chance of exploration to different departments, the happiness of finding the right talent for innovating client’s businesses, & last but not the least feel-good factor to work in a space where we’re making people’s lives better.
cons: Some downsides can be – it’s a cutthroat competition between the agencies and so it’s a highly competitive and target-oriented structure to everyone at every stage working there; which can sometimes lead to hectic arguments and stressful days. Rigorous working hours, as there isn’t any flexibility of working from home usually in normal scenarios. (Albeit, company has been very supportive during COVID-19)
story: I remember talking to one of my managers and expressing how I wanted to grow in the company and how I wanted to add my expertise the best. I am glad how the manager listened to me and help me route the best options available instead of thinking that he/she may lose one of the performing persons from their own team. The manager was very supportive which helped me to be where I am right now. Thank you.

pros:
It's a competitive environment here that promotes healthy competition and encourages you to bring out the best in your work daily. 

There is a lot of interaction involved with Onshore-Offshore teams that not only helps to build bridges for more efficient delivery but also makes people culturally aware. 

Collabera as a brand has a very good reputation as compared to many other staffing firms. It's in the top 20 staffing firms list in the US. So, this definitely adds value to me as a recruiter and helps me build a rapport with my candidates faster. 

The values that Collabera follows are very progressive and it will make sense to anyone who believes in evolving and growing. Not just surviving. 

There are training programs not just to make you a better recruiter but also a better person by fine-tuning your abilities to interact, approach, decide & react to situations that you can easily relate to in your daily life. 

They have daily/weekly/monthly shoutouts and RnR meetings to celebrate and discuss success stories. So no good work goes unnoticed. This keeps people pumped all round the calendar. Attractive goodies will also be showered upon you if you perform exceptionally well. 

At Collabera everyone is on a first-name basis - STRICTLY. While its a professional thing that every other firm will agree to be following but that's not true. But in Collabera this is actually practiced and no one gets offended if you do not address them as Sir/Maam. 

There are many more Pro's but these are a few that popped up right away.
cons:
You can not give your 100% every single day. As its a competitive environment, days when you are emotionally or physically low it becomes stressful to do your work and you hate your work on those days. 

10 hours shift (50 hours weekly) is too much. You work 7-8 hours and rest 2-3 hrs you just wait to pass. For someone who is very fast and does the work in 7 hrs that someone else needs 10 hours to complete, it becomes very frustrating to wait a couple of hours just to clock your daily shift hours. 

Promotions only after you complete 2 years in the company. In extremely rare cases you get an early promotion. I personally haven't witnessed any rare cases yet. 

If the region you are hired for has slow-moving clients or new clients then you are doomed. You will find yourself in various performance enhancement plans leading to terminations within 1 year. 

Recruiter Spread target sometimes feels unrealistic as its equal for all. So doesn't matter what process/direct client, the region you work for, what your cost to the company is, the target is the same.
story: Collabera never stops, sleeps, or backs out. It has a fighting spirit and no matter what the size of trouble it, Collabera always moves forward. The DNA that Collabera has makes it operate at optimal efficiency all the time. Its sales team always wants to do more for the client and the delivery is anxious to exceed 100% quality. With such a team you can never fail. People are trained, shown how it's done, taught to break records and there is nothing mediocre here.

pros:
The first reason I know for sure is the system of everything how Collabera works. 
I joined Collabera not as a fresher but as a tenured guy so in the initial days my mind automatically kept comparing my last company and Collabera, very soon I subconsciously and consciously I realized that Collabera is much better.
cons: For me the one of the cons would be the work hours, as the work hours is of 10 hrs shift which is fine by me but what I do not like is the pressure of working extra hours to finish the tasks. I mean its already 10 hrs of work which is more but the pressure of extending still more is what I do not like.
story: Initially when I started with Collabera, I did not know anyone except for my manager whom I spoke with him in the interview. So one day I was feeling really lonely in the office, I was in training I looked around then I say everyone working so hard while having some kind of a happy expression on their faces. I was wondering how is it that they are so much enjoying their work. Then I took a break to have coffee, my manager joined me. We went upstairs and he spoke to me in a real nice way asking about my goals in life, what are my plans to achieve that, then he spoke about how Collabera supports employees, he spoke about his journey. It was really amazing to have that conversation with him. Then I realized how people working here are so much enjoying their work because Collabera helps people in achieving their personal goals in life as well.

pros: Collabera has given me complete freedom to carve my own destiny. As a high level account manager, my leaders have allowed me to sell and operate at a high level of ambiguity without too much hand holding (as long as I maintain a high level of integrity)
cons: Operationally we still have some growing pains (but that is natural in a large company encroaching on a billion dollars).
story:
First, I think that Collabera is still building a culture, but the below culture is the one that I think we are building towards.

Selfishly, I have gotten a chance to be responsible for a number of promotions of AAM's, due to the business that I have brought in. But not just because they had the opportunity to work on my business, but because I guided them through it, and dedicated my time to teaching them. I think the mentor program is one that should not be overlooked, and we may lose our identity if we do not continue to foster that. I would love to go into more detail about my thoughts in this realm if the opportunity presented itself.

pros: The work culture and the people you work with is very important and there's no other company I would've worked with except for Collabera. I love how people make it a better place for us to work and also cooperate with us,
cons: I dont think there are any to be honest but yes, I do have one tiny issue. Since we work night shifts and do not know how to drive, it is very difficult for me to commute from my place to the office. If Collabera could provide a cab service for ladies that would have been great. This is not a downside but I thought I would point this out. Nothing apart from this I see is a problem.
story:
One of the most favorite and important aspect is responsive beyond imagination. I take it too seriously. In my daily life I tend to follow that and I get really bothered if someone's not even aware of the fact that they should be at least responsive. 
One day I saw a person asking for directions to a particular place, a few didn't know but everyone around him kept ignoring him and didn't answer that they didn't know where the place was. I went upto him, googled the location and helped him with the directions.
If I look at this as a collabera employee, I see that I not only responded him ("Responded beyond imagination") but also the act also meant that I was passionate to serve him which in collabera's culture, one of the value is "passionate to serve our clients and employees".

pros: The best part working with Collabera is, its an employee centric company. We value our employees irrespective of level/designation and give equal opportunity to everyone. We provide the best conducive environment to our people wherein while working they are also getting the opportunity to enhance their learning curve. We have the world class Leadership group, Process oriented, Rewards & Recognition Program, Professional Environment, Employee Friendly Environment, The passion to drive, Responsiveness, Customer centric Business strategy, Strong Diversity Ethics, Stife growth curve for the performers, the list is endless but the most important part is when I'm at work in Collabera I feel like home.
cons: Nothing that I can think of and neither have any notion that any of the Collabera employee even think in that way. We all have our ups and down but we all stand together like a one big happy family.
story: There are many such example but one of the most important which actually helped me during my initial days and made to stick with Collabera family, even though there was many other better offers were there. I relocated from Delhi to Vadodara back in Oct 2018 with high expectation and lot of plans to contribute for the company. During the initial days I had lot of issue in finding the apartment and because of my religion people were saying no wherein I never faced such issue in Delhi. I used to invest sleepless day time to hunt the apartment and during the night used to work on a new job where people were expecting me to change overall team's fortune which was managed by the previous manager for 8 years. The initial hiccups were there for about 2 months though in the end I was able to find the solution but during this time every employee of Collabera extended help in whatever way they could and they ensured I should not face it alone rather get the solution together. I previously worked with 3 more employers and none them have these sort of people. I fall in love with our Collabera family's culture and it just took me short time to gel-up with the management group. So in short our company ensure to provide best support and help not just in professional aspect but personal. We all together are making the best Corporate culture where people are more excited and interested to come to office everyday with happy faces. It was a dream company for me and I'm proud to be a part of the squad.

pros:
My thoughts are valued!
I am able to bring positive impact by decisions and efforts.
I greatly value the?leadership in Collabera!
I love developing my direct reports and seeing them mature!
cons:
At times we are penny wise and dollar foolish with decisions we make.  At times we implement sales contests or make decisions to evaluate staff without seeking input from the managers who manage the staff.
We are email obsessed in Collabera and often times we answer an email only to be asked 2-3 more times for the data or answer.
There is still an school thinking that volumes of submittals will win business whereas I feel we need to train our recruiters to be more efficient in finding suitable candidates and being more thorough in our vetting of those candidates.

pros: Job duties, sharping my skills, gaining experience and
cons: Pay, negative family life impact, unrealistic expectations, not being recognized for achievements, not being taken seriously, little-to-no growth opportunities, and the unspoken culture (the culture that exists at Collabera for employees who don't generate sales/growth).
story:
If you take a good look at the cultural values of Collabera and how they are presented to the employees who don't generate sales/growth - they basically tell you that work is more important that anything else.  

Work hard and play hard - only at work though.   They want you to work hard and long and also hang out/do activities with them.  

Passion to serve - make sure you get your duties done without complaint. 

Responsive beyond imagination - don't stop working, you need to have your response before we even ask.

Insanely competitive - sell your coworkers out.  While not being told this directly, management has told me to find other people's mistakes, fix them, and then brag about it to them so they can show to the higher management that what you found is are worth your salary (this is outside of your normal job duties).

 Disciplined to achieve excellence in execution - Make sure you are disciplined enough to get your duties done correctly even with unrealistic timelines

pros:
In every org, an employee looks for an equal opportunity platform and being a woman, it matters to me a lot. Here, at Collabera we get the equal right to speak and express, and we have our voice over the table. Another factor that is important is the working culture; people generally feel that night shift is going to be boring and lethargic but it's not the case here with us. We have a lively environment and the cosmopolitan culture makes it more vibrant like "unity in diversity". We celebrate festivals, our families are at times part of it too, we encourage sports, and we learn new tech, take trainings and has options for further studies too.  Our work is recognized too and has a fair and transparent system.
Collabera gives us the best platform to not only grow professionally, but we see personal growth too.
cons: The canteen food is not at all hygienic and issues with parking area "it becomes mini vishwamitri". At times, I personally feel, onshore gets more priorities than we do.
story: I will take a recent incident to share. March 23rd, 2020; I was running temperature and all other symptoms of COVID-19 and there was no clinic open to get basic check up done and some medication. I somehow found one clinic and that doctor asked me to visit to SSG (as that was the only hospital that was authorized and doing COVID-19 tests in the initial days)I went there and all my symptoms were positive and doctors asked me to go for quarantine for 14 days. I informed my manager about this as soon as I came home. Since day 1; my Manager, my team and few executive level people never missed a single day to check on me and motivate me that everything will be fine and I can fight this. There were days when I felt I cannot take it any more but every day they made sure to call and text and keep my spirits high!! We are truly passionate about our work, our teams, and our goals.

pros:
'- Once you work for sometime here it becomes 'home' for your professional life. you live, eat, breathe, sleep Collabera !
- Ever growing, ever developing approach makes you want more of it
- Never missed to pay me salary in 13 years
- Open door policy
- Extremely safe working environment esp for females
- Well enabled IT systems/facilities
cons:
'- Frequent change in staff - both at ground level and leadership. depletes efficiency
- Undue Increased level of performance governance in recent years; Metrics are everything, regardless of what they measure
- Little work-life balance
- Female employee promotion/growth/development is hardly seen except sales role; employee development plans should include middle management
- Hidden bias esp amongst top delivery leadership; once labeled it remains with you for lifetime
- Different common objectives/goals even among the same team 
- Tenure renders zero benefit ; 
- Multi levels of undue approvals required even for non-financial transactions
- Diversity of thought is encouraged but not implemented
- Employee-first culture should be brought back
story:
** GCI /Collabera  used to provide food for night shift workers and during recession, it was stopped. as i had just started and was not in a team with high commission opportunity; Collabera management approved a sum of amount every month aside from pay for me to be able to afford my daily meals. This is what Collabera Cuture was all about , Welfare and Care at core be it for client, consultant or internal employees ! 
** Offshore was considered one amongst the team ; that developed the competitiveness and one team-ness

pros:
Reasons to work for collabera (indian perspective)
1. Weekends are holidays : not many companies provide sat & sun as holidays.
2. Prestige : Collabera is famous and people have a favourable opinion towards it, working for collabera makes people believe you're better than average.
3. Trips & picnics : Collabera takes its employees who win E3 contest on trips and picnics twice a year, winning that is a dream for many departments.
cons:
Again indian perpective
1. Overworked : all the employees are overworked and overburdened, there is no such thing as over time, many employees regularly stay beyond normal working hours sometimes as much as 12-15 hours, without getting paid OT, I guess US employees are lucky in that regard.
2 Low Wages : Collabera is not a good paymaster, when it comes to salaries. The amount of work done is inversely proportional to salaries received. Employees would appreciate if collabera gave higher than average salaries for once.
3. Holidays : getting sick days and holidays approved is a hassle, we do not get holidays on indian festivals, but we also do not get holidays on ALL American holidays. Being on American holidays in india is awkward and not fun when relatives ask your whereabouts on indian holidays and youre siitting in the office, we have many indian holidays. collabera should provide us atleast major indian holidays.
story:
I got a good story maybe this will help:

in 2019, it was raining heavily in a city called Vadodara, rains were so bad the entire city was flooded in mere hours, employees were trapped as several bridges were blocked by the police. During late evening the rains stopped but city was still flooded, in such times when the company could transport its employees to their homes safely, rather were busy bringing them to office from their homes in a company run car. Even in such dangerous times the company only cared about its manhours loss and not endangering lives of its employees. I somehow got home driving my car in 5 foot deep water with warning from police on radios blaring that turtles and alligators were in the flooded waters. That's the moment I realised the collabera values!

the performance.

cons: In Collabera the pay scale and incentives are very less, as compared to the hard work we do. Also pay scale and incentives are lowest as compared to other staffing companies. story: Its not the story but my experience. It was an incident of few months later, when I joined Collabera. My department was going for an outing and everyone paid specific amount for that. I was unable to go due to my weak financial condition, so I dropped idea of joining my colleagues, but when my colleagues and manager came to know this they told me to join and helped me financially, because I think, m y happiness and well being was more important for them than that of money. I am very thankful to my managers and colleagues. Also they helped me whenever I needed in terms of any kind of help. So collabera's people and culture is really awesome.

All my works nicely appreciated and rewarded, Collabera is "The Best". 
I believe all of you would've have been agree that we all love working with Collabera's culture always. It's my fortunate and privilege to work here. Thank you for the opportunity to be here today.

pros: culture, financial independence, rewards and recognition (on top of learnings that comes by default )
cons: AT times performance Pressure however I have always been supported by my superiors so even if something doesn't workout they are always there to guide me
story:
I'd really want to express my gratitude towards the kind of support and faith Collabera has given me. We've heard many stories where people did something extra and they got recognized or awarded which is obviously how we celebrate success however this one incident definitely made sure that I would love to stick to this Company forever. This was around last year AUgust(2019) time when I happened to get severely sick. Initially I thought I'd get better within a month however it took me 3 Months to recover and get back to office. All these time only stressing part for me was my Job. I was so scarred to loose my job or after coming back having performance pressure however my superiors (Sid, Arpit, Saqib ) was so supportive and kept motivating me. They did not only help me while I was sick but they also helped me when I joined back and looking at my health issues they let me get into  Corporate Recruitment also Sanyam showed faith in me which eventually helped me to perform well.
At times what you remember is how were you being treated and that is where I did feel that this company definitely values their employee.
I am forever thankful to everybody who has supported me by far and after this incident I'd always make sure that my performance should always speak for myself.

cons_cleaned: time performance pressure supported superior workout guide

pros: Opportunity to take a staffing firm to next level, career growth,, voice at the table, so much work to be done which is exciting.
cons: I know what we are trying to accomplish but there’s a feeling of desperation sometimes to be just like other firms VS being ourselves, minimal collaboration, minimal sharing of resources, technology is behind, basically we look at the way insight global does things and we just copy it when we aren’t built the same way. Truly need to rethink our strategy & direction to pave our own path and couple proper expectations around that.
story: I am trying to build a new division for the company and it feels like a war each day in the offices to gain trust or collaborate. Each division and even more granular, each office has a different culture depending on your prior staffing firm. No one is being held accountable to follow Collabera’s way / culture because there isn’t any. It’s “follow the best practices from your old firm and do it that way” which is why it’s so hard for us to share knowledge and trust each other. If you came from the same staffing firm as someone else, it becomes a clique and others are being left behind.

pros: Collabera has a great work culture and Highly competitive environment which i personally like
cons: There are not many career options to choose from in collabera apart from recruiting, so when an employee wants to switch to marketing or finance or some other field of work apart from collabera, there is not many options.
story: Once as a proactive recruiter, i closed a candidate and got them submitted over a req and my manager was aware about it. The req for some reasons wasn't fitting in the criteria of that candidate as we had to file for their H1 and the account manager wasn't ready to nominate her name, in this scenario, the account manager of that team started blaming me for getting that candidate submitted for her client, but my manager took my stand and said that he knew about this from the start and knows that this has been done correctly according to the process of collabera (as my manager strictly sticks to the process). Manager taking my side on something when i was falsely being accused was very encouraging and i liked the gesture.

pros:
Collabera lets me be both independent and disciplined at the same time; and it's not easy to pull off such a quality with a bigger workforce. 
Imbibing the spirit of teamwork from the first day of training says a lot about "Actions speak louder than words". 
In my term right now, 5th month going on, I have seen that personal growth is determined the most by individual input; to outshine others you have to have some quality that helps you grow, the organization will only act as a catalyst.
cons:
Night-shift working takes time to adjust, given the fact that my work started and within 3 weeks I am working from home.
What everyone says about not having a really enthusiastic social life; is what I don't agree, we all find a new social circle within teams/departments/organisations.
I am a post graduate still I am on the payrolls of a graduate; there should be some distinction, I used to have this as a downside earlier, not anymore.
story:
One of the values of the company is "Passionate to service Employees and Clients".
I would just take the word Passion from this and I have seen the passion of people to get others the job, striving seamlessly and over and over the same routine to mark their presence.
Passion also when people take breaks they ensure they go together with the team that they are competing. Often same targets leads to competition but everything is fair whether competing or eating. 
And such passion results in "Work Hard (together); Play Hard (together)"

pros:
Reasons would be many, but I would like to point out some:
1.Work hard, Play hard: This has never made me feel, night shift is too tough or monotonous, rather it has helped me to look into a more positive side.
2. For me Collabera has always been employee concerned, as an employee, what are my problems, how it can be resolved and it taking measures to help in every way in this pandemic as well.
3. I think one of the best reason to work at Collabera, would be because of Vinay sir, looking at his passion, looking things always at a positive side and always inspiring, but too down to earth as a leader, makes me feel I am working for the right organization in my career.
cons: Nothing as such in particular, but yes everyone has their own point of view, and making someone understand your point of view, would be tricky sometimes.
story: Well not a story, but many instance I would say, as I mentioned above, in this pandemic, it would also be very necessary to Work hard and Play hard, for our peace of mind as well. Because of need, I used to work late, but my manager who used to work in Collabera and current manager as well, always used to say, go home, its late, have fun, kaam hota rahega, kal kar lena. Seniors, managers in Collabera always strive for excellency, targets, but has been never let you down by putting pressure just to achieve excellency. I feel this should be one of the many things, which makes an employee happy and work hard and play hard as well.

pros: Collabera provides good opportunities for new college graduates to start out their career. Collabera also has offices all over the world which provides a global perspective and endless opportunities for business
cons: The reward for doing good work, is more work. Things are always done in a reactive way instead of proactive and we refuse to pay for good functioning systems. We also don't match 401Ks which is just incredibly frustrating and makes me feel like Collabera does not want to invest in me. pros: Collabera is headed by visionary leaders and the agility at work keeps me on my toe. Acceptance of new idea and constant efforts to improve drives my passion to continue working for Collabera. Recognition & appreciation at right intervals have kept me motivated. Challenges & problems have given me opportunity to showcase my creativity & utilize my skills. Over and above these points my most important reason to work for Collabera is that I can see a career path for me.
cons: A competitive compensation is missing. Work life balance have always been a top concern while working here. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle & providing quality time to family has been a challenge. Another key observation is that majority of our leaders are home grown, they are best at their work but lack exposure due to less or no experience of other Industry/Company (Unilateral thinking. Company has seen lot of changes in recent time. I think too many changes might create confusion among employees.
story: After I joined Collabera, within 6 months I got the opportunity to change the existing new hire training process. They trusted a new guy with such an important responsibility motivated me to give my best. All the stakeholders were involved and each one was passionate to create a better & robust training module. I have seen all of us working meticulously for late hours, directors/managers making time from their busy schedule and governing the entire process so smoothly that we could be operational on the decided timeline. Results were better than we expected and we did not stop there, this process even sustains after 2 years and have been modified when required. A constant review of it's relevance with regards to new polices gave us a heads-up if we need to change. I think this event had all the 5 cultural values that Collabera stands for.

pros: I love my boss. I enjoy my work very much. I believe Collabera and upper management have a genuine desire to ensure I am happy with my job. I feel that they listen to me. I feel supported and backed up whenever i feel challenged by my work or other employees.
cons: I'm a bit underpaid when compared to others across the country that do my job with the same level of experience.
story:
I think it all comes down to our core values that we all work to achieve on a daily basis. The one thing that stands out in my mind is how our people have worked tirelessly to help our clients during this pandemic. Our culture is about being in the people business that includes caring about our employees and our clients. That means a great deal to me and makes me proud to be apart of Collabera. 

The first thing i noticed when i got hired was that every single person i worked with no matter where they were located are all over achievers and very passionate about their work. That is the first time I have experienced that working at a company. There's always some people that don't pull their own weight but at Collabera that is not the case. Everyone is extremely responsive and we all give 150%. We are disciplined and very, very competitive as seen on a daily basis in how we work until the job is done, and we strive to help Collabera grow year over year. I also love how we mix work and play to ensure there is a nice balance. That is so important in life. We have amazing parties, dinners, events and we care about the communities that we work in. Watching our employees volunteer to feed the homeless, or have fundraisers or just to reach out and help someone is what we are all about. I am 100% team Collabera!

story:
Some years back I was on planed leave from Monday and on Friday we got an email to arrange accommodation for new joiner’s batch and numbers of new joiners were high and to manage it seems to be difficult. 
Same time my Manager was on leave and it was difficult to take advice for managing the situation, so we spoke with him on Cell and as per His advice we made plan to give accommodation to few new joiners in hotel and for which we took quotes for hotel and went to Authorized Person to take approval for giving accommodation in hotel and for amount. But after having discussion with Authorized person we did not have the approval.
Somehow we were able to manage situation with given facility. 
From the above situation I had a very good experience and learnt that as we did not have approval to give accommodation in hotel from Authorized Person, but still we were able to manage the situation with given facility only.  We have to take things in positive way in any condition.

pros: For someone who is just starting their career, I cannot suggest any other employer than Collabera (as of now). There is joyous vibe the office environment brings in, mainly due to the people around. I really really appreciate the fact that I do not need address someone sir/Ma'am, That'd be very weird. There are some magnificent people in Collabera, who at times have made myself question my own role, eventually helped me to better myself as a part of a bigger entity.
cons: This is sensational. Being a part of my team, I see this everyday. Because your number speaks volumes about your performance, does not really mean that you are ready to go up that ladder and be in leadership position. Before whatever role you play in the company, We need affirm-ate being a human first. It works the other way too. You do not become a good leader because your designation says so. We need leaders not bosses. Not the people who order and watch, but the ones who initiate and inspire.
story: This is not a pleasant memory. A little over 6 months into my journey with Collabera, I am really working hard and learning how to perfect what I was doing. On the other hand I was feeling more monotonous it was always the same. There was nothing challenging anymore in my daily transactions. I really wanted see if I can add behavioral training into my portfolio which really is my background. I might have needed real help considering the target audience, But I really wanted to to work. This is also because that is where I see myself in the long-run. I remember Reaching out to my manager at the time, who is also the HOD, to initiate a discussion on this. So I went inside her cabin and proposed the vision. There was another member of the team who is taking care of the same at the time. When I proposed the idea, my manager at the time gave me speech on what makes the other member of the team eligible for he is doing and how he made himself so incredible along with the role. this lasted for more than 30 minutes. Majority of the time I was listening to why I should not do What I really think I am capable of and interested in because I am unlike the other person. I walked out of that cabin trying to make sense out of what she said. I never did. And I still do not. I believe every organization is an ecosystem. But survival of the fittest does not apply here. We need leaders who are ready to create opportunities for their people because they believe in them, Not because he/she is your favorite. You need to make everyone of them feels like by doing the right thing from their scale, they are making a change too. every single one of them matters too. And then that is an healthy ecosystem. Otherwise you have employees who work for you because you pay them.

pros: I came to Collabera for the opportunity to grow with an organization and hopefully get into leadership. Collabera has taken the time to invest in me to get me to my professional goals. The culture of Collabera is amazing and our company is constantly trying to find competitive advantages in our industry. Whether that be new service offerings or rolling out new Applications that make our job easier. Collabera wants to be an industry leader and I believe the company is doing everything they can do that.
cons:
I would say there are a lot of growing pains at Collabera. From certain internal process, to systems, to overload of unnecessary emails, etc... I still think Collabera is still trying to figure out things since we have gone to a Regional model. That was a big company wide mindset shift and I think we are still learning. I think some of the training we could improve for recruiters and sales. 
I do feel that delivery sometimes does not trust Account Managers that are working directly with clients. We see this in having to jump through hoops to get positions changed to QP or Direct. That can be very frustrating at times when a sales person is doing everything they can to close business.
All in all I think Collabera is trying to do the right thing to improve our business. We just have a lot of internals things that need to be ironed out.
story: My favorite story is when I went to PC / Cancun trip within my first year at Collabera. I was blessed to make it to Cancun as a milestone achiever and on my flight there I hit $10K. Whenever I arrived people were congratulating me on the achievement and made me feel very appreciated. I think Collabera does a great job is showing this appreciation to its employees and celebrating the achievements.

pros: One thing i like about Collabera is that they have Good Incentives, Competitions, Awards for all of their employees which is Open for all specially the Presidents club. The ofc setup and environment is good to work.
cons: Hard work sometimes goes unnoticed due to favoritism or dislike towards a person and promotion gets hampered. No proper communication among sr. managers and the HR team specially when it comes to any issues or promotions. No proper road map provided for promotions.  No proper resolution or attention to such issues at all from.  One more Con would be that you can be a winner in such competitions only if you have a good running accounts, which otherwise no matter how hard you try, you will not overcome it. So again these competitions would be fruitful to limited set of audience and not to those supporting low sided business. This point of awards I am presenting from every persons perspective and not just my point.
story: One of the best experiences so far with Collabera is the PC awards. They give the best experience of a lifetime in such events by having trips. 2nd is the Blaze awards. These are some of the best things about Collabera which I admire. One of the negative experience is that when it comes to promotion cycles there is no proper roadmap and promotion is only measured based on numbers achieved irrespective of slow accounts given by managers. Effort level is not considered. I believe its really unfair as when a person is given a slow moving accounts and then expect high numbers and still donot give them the promotions even after working on those for 2 years stating numbers are not inline. Team size is also cut down, seniors are moved out due to slow accounts and then the expectation is to build a backup of yourself when the team consists only of 1-2 years old recruiters. HR does not have much say or take any action here. Favoritism is at the peak in some teams. Have experience this not once but twice during my tenure.

pros:
Very important of all is my company Collabera stood and is standing very supportive during this difficult time of COVID-19. Today i am very awesome, feel safe working from home, caring for family members needs all is because of my job and my company support. 

The working culture, Top management Support, lead supports, team support, Recognition awards, Knowledge transfer from co-workers, transparency in all progress, A completely process driven, Promotions, Growing opportunity through various training programs, indoor competitions, Good Incentive plans, supported with Sick leaves, Insurance support, The salary date is always on time, Delicious Dinner for night shift bangalore team.
cons: I am very honest I dont have any Cons because company has taken care of me at its best during my difficult times. i even typed above only it is because i must minimum meet 50 characters.
story: I started my day 1 with Collabera on Oct 8th 2018, from the day 1 i never looked back till date, i am extremely proud of my decision. I joined Collabera after leaving a long time employment with my previous company. I have no regrets in my decision, i liked the challenges that was thrown on the floor, the appreciation awards i received for my success, My managers, leads and coworkers valued me very well and supported me with a 100 percent knowledge transfer of clients i was assigned and work. i was surprised by this support because in most of the company's the coworkers don’t share their success practice with their colleges being afraid of competition BUT in Collabera every single person i met was just ready to help me at work unconditionally, i loved the way i was treated. My Manager Jaspal Nandra who hired me for Cisco, Amit Sharma my first manager at Cisco, My First lead Venkat Gummadi, My Bangalore Boss Vinod, Present boss Hardev Singh, My Present Reporting manager Arjun Sharma, Varun Patel all are very important members of Collabera whom I worked and working now are very supportive at my work. Arjun sir is a very good manager . he never let me down during my difficult times. his encouraging words always pushed me with an extra force to do my work. i have nothing to share Negative. But many who are not part of Collabera. who were not able to be successfully even after given chances to perform may speak Ill.

pros: There is a lot to learn. A lot has to do with there not being a choice because of the lack of resources and lack of training/knowledge of the part of outside of the department. However, I do view the ability to learn more, regardless of how/why, to be a positive for my career and personal self.
cons: There continues to bolstering of 1 area of the company (sales) and lack of acknowledgment and bringing togetherness. I understand sales technically makes the money but I think there are a lot of pieces to that puzzle the need to come together to enable Collabera to be successful as it has been and will continue to be going forward.
story: I enjoy working with and for the people I do. However, it seems that everyone outside of sales is here to just serve sales. In a sense I get it but only cultivate this I don't think is good for the company and all employees as a whole. There is also the big problem of compensation. When it's not equivalent to the average of other companies with similar income and size but also a lack of incentive, it becomes 1 of the, if not the single biggest, issues. We talk about family and one-team at Collabera but at the end of the day, everyone is trying to make money to care for their family and the future. The company can be only so good to its employees but it the compensation is vastly unproportional, the other good aspects get lost.

pros: Our working culture is really sorted and well aligned. There are barely any confusions in regard to what work needs to be done by whom. This is one of the best reason as we tend to perform in a more efficient way when we exactly know what we need to be doing
cons: I feel that the middle management people and some people that are just starting their management career and taking it ahead kind of lack some support and enthusiasm from the upper management.
story:
A Recruitment Manager (Delivery Lead) joins the company in the middle of the year, supporting a really emerging and yet to grow region. When he comes, he is full of excitement to support a different region and territory and takes the region to a new ATH within 2 quarters of joining. He felt really happy and accomplished. Later the next year, as supposed the numbers were falling down and then suddenly Covid came into place. Now the pressure started building and things were turning South slowly and steadily. He was then offered to take up the lead and start some hands on work to bring the region back to action. He took this as a challenge and has been trying to bring the business up.

Now, the good thing and an area which really helped him make the ATH happen was that the work was really sorted and he was capable to do way more than ever because of the support that all the teams in the company provide. The immediate managers and upper management were really supporting in all the aspects. A little thing that might be better was that when the downfall came and things were going south, The Delivery Lead made sure that he connects with all the resources and tries to make sure that they still have the motivation and faith like they had before. However, there was not so much support and connects to happen with the Delivery Lead. We could take it as once getting into a management role, the person has to be self motivated. However, it is always better to have someone to count on and to talk to.

pros: We work hard to achieve our targets but party and enjoy harder together as a family. We celebrate all the festivals with joy and happiness. Also we have a very friendly environment and each and every person is there to help anyone in need. We are also appreciated and recognised for our work. The HR over here are friendly and interact with us all the time and helps us in whatever way possible. Even i this pandemic the organisation has taken well care of their employees and helped us with all he necessary requirements so that we can effectively work from home too.
cons: As we know every coin has two sides. Although there are just a few demerits of working at Collabera. The shift timings was a challenge in the beginning as I was not able to manage to talk to my family members and it also affected my health. There is a huge competition within the organisation. The long working hours get tiring sometimes.
story: I still remember the initial days when I joined Collabera, I was too nervous. Also me being an introvert I never asked questions even though I did not understand something. I then had an interaction with my HRBP and even though I did not tell her anything she found out I was introvert and feared from asking questions. Since then she had put a lot of effort towards helping me. She used to make me how to interact with people and ask me with how many I interacted in a daily basis. She used to be on the other side of call and made me practice how to call the candidates. How to fluently speak with confident. And till now she has been there for all the doubts and queries and has always motivated me to give my best.

pros: At Collabera, you feel valued and your voice is heard, no matter how large the company gets.  I love the flexibility, compensation, incentives, and opportunity that Collabera provides me as well.  I've worked for other major staffing firms in the past, and while Collabera certainly has it's pros and cons, it is by far my favorite place to work, and I don't see myself leaving.
cons: It's challenging to be impactful locally when majority of our delivery staff is offshore.  We also have quite a few broken technical systems that could use some serious integration and moderinzation.  Our training needs to be improved immensely and staffed with individuals who have actually been in sales in the past with continuous development and more consistency across the board when it comes to tranining, mentorship, etc. so we see success in all regional offices, not jusst some.  It's also frustrating to see lack of diversity on our executive level - we need more females and people of different ethnicities for a more well-rounded perspective.
story: Collabera has become family to me.  My husband and I were experiencing fertility issues after having our first daughter.  We lost two pregnancies in a row and it was a very depressing time for me personally.  My office all pitched in to get me a gift card for a tree farm to plant a memorial tree for our babies that went to heaven.  It was the most moving thing that has happened to me professionally, and I will absolutely never forget it.

story:
My journey started from a "Beg, Borrow, Steal mode of recruiting a decade back! We have clearly come to ages in our approach but the killer attitude never dies! 
One story that really touches me was how we used to kill our competition. The MSP used to release requirement after 5-6 PM EST on a Friday! While this might mostly get ignored by our competition but for us, this was an OPPORTUNITY! We used to go all guns blazing to sweep the whole market!

Collabera's evolution! From a pure plug delivery engine, we transformed into a full package with more and more focus going into the Hiring, training and leadership development..

pros:
1) Culture: Culture followed and inculcated in you from the time you join Collabera is one of the best things which has kept me going.
2)Opportunities: I can bet that amount of career and growth opportunities you get, not many companies can match it.
3)Financial Stability: Little things like crediting salary on time, competitive pay packages. Goes long way. 
4)Client Exposure: The type of direct exposure that you get with leading fortune 500 clients is simply a different experience
5)Work Environment: Communication is very open, managers literally care for their employees.
cons:
1) Night shift: 5 days a week I don't get any time for the family and work life balance takes a serious hit; however, since the time I have started working from home those challenges do not exist.
2) Desktops and Systems: Though company has tried upgrading systems of all employees it still keeps me thinking that every major IT company provides laptops why we are still providing our employees with old desktops. 
3) Salary Structure: While you end up making good amount of package compared to other companies, 60% of your annual package is still dependent on incentives which is good for youngsters but as you age and get more responsibilities this uncertainty gives you anxiety.
story: When I joined for the first time I was not performing good enough for initial 6 months and I thought that I won't be able to continue with this organization for more than 6 months. But the way my mentor kept motivating me and never gave up on me made me work here for more than 7 years. I initially had applied for my field job before joining Collabera and post joining Collabera, I even got that job but culture at Collabera made me decline that opportunity.

pros: 1) Ample learning opportunities 2) Transparent work culture
cons: 1) Extended working shift (10 hrs) which may extend based on the project / biz need creating work life imbalance especially in night shift environment. As per Labor Laws in India it is 8 hrs working.
story: There are lot of positive experiences I have with Collabera and that's the reason for my association with Collabera. However here I will share a Negative experience working with cross functional teams. For few departments - Few roles are very fluid in nature (especially corporate function / GBS). Due to subjectivity associated there are individuals who are either over burned with extensive work load OR there are individuals who find easy excuse route to shrug work load on others. Lack of objective evaluation of each resource develops complacency in system. Organization allows descent learning time which is positive aspect however promoting mediocrity is not fair. e.g resource is allowed to work in specific department without core skills for that department / job. (Training are also provided to such individuals which is positive aspect but again application of trained aspects in job role are not evaluated objectively. Hence resource does not have pressure to apply training principles and there is barely any improvement).

pros: Lucky to be part of an great team and a leadership with very clear visions and target with very little ambiguity.
cons: Limited play area to up-skill my team and transform them into tomorrow's workforce.
story:
Well, it's almost 2:00 AM and I am almost about to call my day when a team member from one of the team pings and asks whether I am still at desk.

Almost instantly, I respond back saying I am calling him. She is a new team member and I knew the team lead had to go on a sudden emergency due to a family emergency and her manager was on a planned leave. She was following the standard escalation procedure and reaching out to me. Wasn't quite sure about the criticality but wanted to address whatever was brewing up as soon as possible.

As I login the bridge and she starts explaining the situation saying she tried to reach others, dropped them a message and then called me. She comes to the issue at hand and this is when I understand while the task at hand is not something that's handled by our team anymore, in the past we did handle that and as I was trying to look through my notes, I realized someone joining the bridge.

To my surprise, I see her manager joining the call and surprised I ask, how come she is joining and here comes the response - "I checked my messages and realized there's an issue at hand and know that lead had to leave all of a sudden", The next thing I hear is that I should leave since she (Manager) is in the call and she should be able to drive things and ping me if necessary.

As I send a smiley and about to exit, I hear another ping and this time it's the lead. This time both lead and manager kind or pass a surprised message at each other asking how come they joined when they were not supposed to be there.

At this time, I kind of burst out in laughter and say, practically I was the only one supposed to be there but with two powerful ladies around, I must drop off.

 - Well, I must say that if this is not a true reflection of "Responsive" and "Passionate" then what else better describes those objectives.

cons_cleaned: limited play area up-skill team transform tomorrow's workforce

pros: The best reason for me use to be how well one gets paid at Collabera which in my case has changed in recent times as I have been moved to an account with no incentives because I requested to change the team I was previously working for 2 years and the reason of the switch was constant insult and humiliation in front of other team members.
cons: The lack of empathy of the management, the overbearing work pressure, when employees try to explain their side of the story it is often considered as a complaint that is coming out of the lack of capability of the employee himself.
story:
I told my superior in the hierarchy, that my brother was attacked by a few local boys and my family was going through a hard time at that night and I wasn't able to focus on work because my brother was scared and was having a hard time forgetting the incident and I was supposed to be there for him as his elder sister, I was asked to think of it as something that normally happens with teenage boys and I should stop crying, wash my face and start working, this is one of the many incidents that I have gone through in a tenure of two years the job is important as it brings bread and butter to the table for me and my family and I have nothing bad to say about my job as I love what I do, but there are a few things that can be dealt with differently at the management's front as well. I am glad I could pour down my thoughts in this survey. Thank you for keeping a check on your employees and supporting us in these difficult time of a widespread pandemic.
Yours Truly,
An employee of your prestigious organization.

pros: Culture created by Hemin; good work ethic and never do wrong.
cons: multiple layers; DD don't listen to delivery like Sham and Hemin used to listen, understand & solve their issues. DD's are ONLY interested in talking to SDM as they are their direct reports. No longer it is open door policy like it was earlier with Sham and Hemin. Very dirty politics. DD's are suppose to be backbone of delivery but during weekly/monthly calls in front of RD's they will always make delivery look bad instead of standing for them. DD's have ONLY pointed problems and never provided solutions. I dont think leaders only point problem but they also help solve them and lead by example which is happening right now which never happened with Sham and Hemin.
story: Collabera was very well run at least from where we looked at it when it was 100% managed by Sham and Hemin. I remembers, when anything would go wrong or would not work the way expected, Hemin would immediately jump in and give his ideas and help at the ground level. That in my opinion was the culture of Collabera that irrespective of your job title, do whatever it takes to bring your people, your team up and grow them along with the company. But now, with so many layers, accountability has diluted and pin pointing has increased.

pros: Collabera is employee centric. It provides all its employees the deserved chance, appreciation and growth. All the leaders in the company are extremely supportive and lead by an example. One can learn by following them simply and talking to them will surely take the individual to next level of performance. Its opendoor policy surely is worth appreciation. Collabera makes one feel awesome from within which automatically brings out excellence in performances.
cons: I haven't had any in last 4.5 years. I havent personally felt any downsides.
story:
There is so much to mention here:We all live by our core values. Every one here exemplifies how beautiful it is to work in Collabera.
The leaders are Disciplined in execution and Responsive beyond imagination. So much to learn from them. It feels amazing to be greeted with consistent big smile and the approach "we are awesome" feels so full of energy. The energy that flows in the audience from the Blaze stage is unmatched. One of the best examples i could think of here is CPL- the passion and zeal with which each employee engagement activity is carried out is truely amazing. And when the leaders wholeheartedly participate and take the game spirit to the next level is surely worth watching. That's how we work at Collabera- we are energetic, passionate, disciplined and awesome people who together work to achieve the set targets.

pros:
I work at Collabera because I serve the top client - Amazon. 
I love the culture
Love how I have always seen the leadership heavily investing in learning and development of employees
I was given an opportunity to travel to the US in 2019, which I count in as a lifetime experience
Friendly and encouraging managers! I absolutely love my managers - Archana, Sheetal, and Saparsh.
cons: I can't think of much but a lot of times I feel if I had the same career preferably on the corporate side and I was onshore, that would have been great.
story:
I have been a part of Collabera for around 5 years now and I have been attending Blaze over all these years except for the last time. I made a move to Bangalore and I was not invited to Vadodara which was disappointing but understandable, 
That was the time I realized how important it is for me to be there to celebrate our achievements of the whole year, be there to be a part of my teammates who won Blaze and experience it all.
At that moment, I figured out that I have really grown a quality to work hard and play hard and that is exactly what was burning inside my stomach when I wasn't able to be a part of the MOST fun event of Collabera.

cons: The Major one is impacting our health because of the entire reverse routine, our social life if completely impacted with it. pros: There is ample importunity at this company, if I see a opportunity- I can take it, more importantly with the support of upper management. I have the freedom to pursue tasks that I see fit, and have a good management structure that I can rely on to enable me to be a productive employee. I have worked at Fortune 500 companies, I can confidently say that the opportunity to learn here is better.
cons: We are in a awkward stage between a small company and a medium to large, so some of our processes are changing to adapt to large volume, some are still rather manual and a work in progress. The benefits are mediocre (no 401k match, salary is not competitive, however the opportunity to learn could arguably be better than other Fortune 500 companies.
story: I sit in the Headquarters of the building which gives me the opportunity to converse with Executives on a daily basis- and also really get a feel for the culture based on the environment of our workspace. One experience that comes to mind is our Employee Appreciation Week, it truly brightens and brings to light that Collabera cares about its employees just as much as its clients. Instead of us helping the management, the executives will serve us ice cream and set up the lunch buffets, etc. While we have a client-centric focus year round, this time is where we get recognition for all of our hard work year round.

story:
One story that touched my heart at Collabera so far has been when I was onsite at our HQ in NJ as a Recruiter in 2008. It was my first visit to US. Although we had a challenging year with Recession looming charge, I had a successful year and I was able to do 36 starts in 36 weeks being onsite. 
Sham decided to host a farewell lunch and invited all VPs, NAMs and DMs for that lunch. He gifted me iPod and $1000 gift check and Thank you Letter. It was not the gift or amount that mattered but this gesture really meant a lot to me and showed how much people care here.
This shows how passionate Collabera is towards its employees.

I walked in and immediately the other AAMs, AMs, and managers wanted us to succeed. I still believe they do. We all help each other learn. I honestly feel like colleagues are like family in a way. I don’t feel nervous to ask questions when I am confused. I also love the competitiveness In the room. I get an adrenaline rush at work. I want to succeed and everyone else in my office and colleagues at other offices want to do well as well. Everyone is rooting for each other.

pros:
Many... but one, in particular - would be Ravi Kshirsagar
+ Collabera Business Model (It is Super talented in the sense that it finds the right talent and help the ones who requires it. Considering the growth in the staffing industry - we cannot go out of business and there is a long way ahead as long as we keep up and be more solution-oriented about it)
